message.content:
An ox is a domesticated animal of the bovine family, closely related to the cow.
It has a sturdy and robust body with a massive head and muscular neck.
The coat of an ox can vary in color and texture, but it is usually thick and rough.
They have short, strong legs that can support their heavy weight.
Oxen are often used as draft animals for plowing fields, hauling wagons, and pulling carts.
They are found on farms and ranches all around the world.
Oxen are herbivores and have a distinctive slow gait and a low, rumbling grunt.
